title: Vyane maby need an visual update
body: IF you compare Vyane to some champs toaday, Vyane is looking way to old{{item:3073}} {{champion:67}} {{item:3073}}

replies.body:
Maybe if you compare her to today's crop, but so do all the champs from her year.

If you think she looks worse than the Mordes and Eves out there, you crazy. She'll probably get something eventually but that's a ways off.

Wow, that is what I call typo gore, not just the title, but even the actual post – phew!

Vayne is in a similar state as Lee Sin, I would say and i can't see her getting any kit changes,
other than balance numbers or other small stuff.

The great texture rebalance update circa 2 years ago or so did her really well, even though she definitly shows her age. Out of all Champions, that need visual changes, she is without question one of the healthiest at all, so don't expert her to be changed in the next 3-4 years, unless the ChampUp team magically gets much more resources and maybe comes up with a clean up masterplan on top of it.

Dragonslayer has so much potential in general and could be brought more in line with the modern ones of Pantheon & Braum. Heartseeker, also starting of a whole theme of skins, looks totally horrible as ingame model, while having a very good splash art. All of her skins (not counting SKT, Arclight & Soulstealer) could definitly be brought to the next level.

Actual question; recently Riot used the Aurelion tech on Cass to give her tail a well-deserved animation do-over. Would the same be possible for characters with capes, coat-tails or other prominent clothing element to make them flow more naturally? Fiora's a really good example where her cape flows naturally and moves with her if she turns, stops, etc. Could this tech be applied to Vayne, Jayce and Lucian (who currently have rigid clothing)?
Vayne was my first main.  That would be pretty sweet.
What about Draven, Lee, Urgot, and a few others i most likely forgot about

Urgot will be the next VGU after Galio (followed by Evelynn on top of that) and this was announced in the very recent Nexus post by Reav3; before that probably accidently leaked by CertainlyT on stream; is clearly visual in one of the most discussed topic titles on this board (if not even multiple ones) AND was also easy to be informed about on /r/leagueoflegends.

Draven was exactly after Darius the second champion ever to receive a ''modern concept'' with the world of Runeterra, regions & cultures in mind and looks still pretty fresh. 

Lee is pretty much the same case as Vayne, just compare and read the post by Solidair3.
